meanings.definition: Believing in or pursuing high or noble principles, purposes, or goals.
meanings.sent1: She had an idealistic view of the world, always seeing the best in people.
meanings.sent2: His idealistic nature led him to volunteer at the homeless shelter every weekend.
meanings.sent3: It was quite idealistic of him to think he could finish all his homework in just one hour.
meanings.sent4: Her idealistic dreams of a utopian society inspired those around her.
meanings.sent5: The idealistic vision of a peaceful world stayed with her throughout her life.

meanings.definition: Characterized by idealism; unrealistically aiming for perfection.
meanings.sent1: The artist's idealistic pursuit of perfection often led to frustration.
meanings.sent2: Their idealistic approach to solving the problem overlooked practical considerations.
meanings.sent3: It was idealistic of him to believe he could run a marathon without any training.
meanings.sent4: The idealistic quest for the perfect wave consumed the surfer's thoughts.
meanings.sent5: Her idealistic standards for a romantic partner made it hard for her to find love.
